lead_paragraph: Steve Tobin thought his bronze sculpture of a huge sycamore tree that was smashed on Sept. 11, 2001, would stand in a church courtyard in Lower Manhattan forever. Then it was taken to Connecticut.

headline.print_headline: Sculptor ‘Still in Shock’ After Trinity Church Removes His 9/11 Memorial
headline.main: Artist ‘Still in Shock’ After Trinity Church Uproots, and Damages, His 9/11 Work

snippet: Steve Tobin thought his bronze sculpture of a huge sycamore tree that was smashed on Sept. 11, 2001, would stand in a church courtyard in Lower Manhattan forever. Then it was taken to Connecticut....
abstract: Sculptor Steve Tobin expresses shock that Trinity Church moved his Sept 11 memorial sculpture Trinity Root from its Lower Manhattan location to Connecticut without his permission; claims sculpture, which is legally owned by church, was meant to be permanently installed near ground zero and has been substantially damaged in move.
